feed.title: Zac Efron Gets a Lesson in Cuteness, Guitar From Taylor Swift
feed.subtitle: Taylor Swift taught Zac Efron how to play guitar, so they played a little song together on Ellen. If you have a high tolerance for cuteness, watch the video on Dose.

link.title: Zac Efron Gets a Lesson in Cuteness, Guitar From Taylor Swift

content.div:
Lest you think he's just a set of pretty abs, Zac Efron told the L.A. Times that he's been taking guitar lessons from his Lorax costar, Taylor Swift. "She's a great teacher," Efron said from the movie's "orange" carpet. And for proof, we're looking to Efron and Swift's recent visit to the Ellen DeGeneres Show. The costars played their own version of Foster the People's "Pumped Up Kicks" during their interview, and while we won't comment on whether Efron's guitar chops are righteous enough to inspire some Wildcat Pride, he's definitely picked up on one of Swift's most bankable skills: cuteness.

While DeGeneres cracked wise about whether Swift and Efron's relationship status, the duo freestyled their own lyrics. We're partial to Swift's verse, a little nod to her past visits to the program.

"She always asks me who I'm dating everytime I'm on this show/ and I don't even know why/ But it gets five million hits on YouTube!"

She knows us so well. As such, please watch Swift and Efron's duet below. Every view brings us one step closer to five million hits:

leahc@dose.ca

source.title: Zac Efron Gets a Lesson in Cuteness, Guitar From Taylor Swift

entry.title: Adele Making Comeback at BRIT Awards; Will She Be Well Enough for a Grammy Gig, Too?

link.Abstract: Adele will play the BRIT Awards on Feb. 21, buoying hopes that the "Someone Like You" singer might also perform at the Grammy Awards Feb. 12.
link.title: [ more ]

link.Abstract: Adele is confirmed to play the 2012 BRIT Awards on Feb. 21. Here she is at last year's show, shortly before her performance of "Someone Like You" caused a tsunami made of mascara and tears.
link.title: Adele BRIT Awards

link.Abstract: Taylor Swift, Nicki Minaj, Kelly Clarkson and the Foo Fighters are among the first acts confirmed to play the 54th Annual Grammy Awards February 12. Check out who else is booked for music's big night.
link.title: Look Who's Playing the Grammy Awards

link.Abstract: Adele's tour rider leaked and it's outrageous -- for all the right reasons. A lot of pop stars are way more demanding. We've compiled some of the more infamous examples.
link.title: Outrageous Tour Riders

link.Abstract: The Grammy nominations were announced Wednesday, and Kanye West leads the pack. Find out who else is up for a Grammy February 12.
link.title: Kanye West, Adele Lead Grammy Nominations

link.Abstract: Arcade Fire and Justin Bieber repped for Canada at the 2011 BRITs. The gong fest airs on MuchMusic Wednesday, Feb. 16 at 8 p.m. ET, but we've already got pictures from the show.
link.title: Photos: 2011 BRIT Awards

link.Abstract: The VMAs are about fun -- the sort of fun that, this year at least, involves drag and distended wombs and at least a little swapping of spit. Here are a few of Sunday night’s best (and worst) examples.
link.title: Best and Worst Moments at the 2011 MTV VMAs

link.Abstract: Florence + The Machine, Kelly Clarkson, Jennifer Hudson, Jessie J, Mary J. Blige and more "celebrated soul" during the VH1 Divas special Dec. 18 in New York. We've got pictures.
link.title: Photos: Florence + The Machine, Kelly Clarkson and More are VH1 Divas

link.Abstract: Harry Potter's Rupert Grint stars in a new video from English singer-songwriter Ed Sheeran. It's called "Lego House." Watch it here.
link.title: Harry Potter Star Rupert Grint's Latest Role? This Music Video

link.Abstract: Florence + The Machine covered Drake's "Take Care" during an appearance at BBC 1's Live Lounge. Hear it here.
link.title: Video: Florence + The Machine Take On Drake's 'Take Care'

link.Abstract: We're thrilled Chris Martin never made good on his promise to retire at 33. Here's why.
link.title: 10 Reasons To Be a Coldplay Fan

link.Abstract: Noel Gallagher took the stage in Toronto Nov. 7 for his first North American show as Noel Gallagher's High Flying Birds -- or, rather, his first North American show not as a member of Oasis. Dose.ca was there.
link.title: Concert Review: Noel Gallagher's High Flying Birds at Massey Hall

link.Abstract: Run, Florence, run! There's a supernatural hit on Florence + The Machine in new video "No Light, No Light." Watch it here.
link.title: Video: Florence + The Machine Dabble in Dark Arts For 'No Light, No Light' Clip

link.Abstract: Taylor Swift always looks surprised in photos. But here's some news that really deserves an OMG-face: Swift was forced to cancel a series of concert dates due to bronchitis. Yikes! Get well soon, Swifty. It's time you built up your strength. Here, have a sandwich. In fact, have 10. We hope Swift's feeling better in time for her July 14 show in Montreal.
link.title: Gallery: Eat a Sandwich, Taylor Swift
